intro: Cirsium pseudopendulum, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, lance-shaped leaves that have serrated edges and a rough texture. Its flowers are pale purple to pink, forming a rounded cluster at the top of the stem, and it blooms from late summer into early autumn. Cirsium pseudopendulum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
